two new aircraft delivered to raf cosford museum .

text: armed robber raids betting shop

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday .
whatever you have planned this weekend have a good one .

documents.title: coming up on tv : west midlands pays tribute on armistice day ; preparations for children in need
text: on midlands today this evening we 'll have powerful scenes from armistice day services across the west midlands , as well as an update on children in need .
that and more on midlands today from 18:30 on bbc one .

documents.title: weather : more rain to come in shropshire
text: we 're due some more rain in the county , lasting into tomorrow morning .
but it should clear away over the weekend and sunday should be cloudy , but dry .
this photo was taken by one of the bbc weather watchers near gobowen this afternoon .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: shropshire firefighter to play for england
text: a ludlow firefighter has been to play rugby for england 's fire service in a match against wales .
it 's the third year in a row that 26-year-old george jacks has been selected for the game , which will be played in newport in front of an expected 5,000 spectators .
jacks plays at flanker for ludlow rugby club and will wear the number six shirt when he represents his country on 25 november .
unfortunately we have lost every time i 've played but hopefully this time it will be third time lucky and we will win . ''

documents.title: football : tns head to scotland for cup tie
text: the new saints travel up to scotland this weekend to take on livingston in the irn bru cup .
the competition was opened up to teams from wales and northern ireland this year and tns are the sole remaining non-scottish side left in the tournament .
their scottish league one opponents were forced to play a replay against crusaders of northern ireland in the previous round , after fielding an ineligible player .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: broseley 's last bank closing its doors
text: the last bank left in broseley will close its doors for the final time next year .
author: South Shropshire Journal

documents.title: police plan to deport thieves
text: police have revealed they will work to deport two romanian nationals jailed for a string of distraction thefts .
bogdan vranceanu , 31 , and atena calin , 20 , both of no fixed abode , were sentenced to six months and three months respectively after admitting five counts of theft each .
between 13 september and 26 september this year , 10 people had purses stolen while shopping in supermarkets in shrewsbury , malvern , droitwich , leominster , kidderminster , evesham and hereford .
west mercia police det seg julie shephard called the pair `` skilled fraudsters '' .

documents.title: two new aircraft arrive at raf museum
text: the raf cosford museum has got two new aircraft on display .
the german messerschmitt and the tiger moth are the first of six new planes being transferred there from its sister-museum in london , which is having a reorganisation .
both planes were driven up on the back of lorries and are now on display in one of the hangars .
the remaining aircraft are due to arrive before christmas .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : armistice day commemorations ; funding for rural health service ; museum gets two new planes
text: our headlines this evening :
- shropshire marks armistice day with ceremonies around the county
- shropdoc given £ 75,000 to fund new rural health service
- two new aircraft delivered to raf cosford museum
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: your photos : chilly weather for armistice day
text: we 've had some chilly weather for armistice day , as you can see in this photo by one of the bbc weather watchers , taken near shrewsbury this morning .
we 've also seen some beautiful blue skies overhead .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shifnal man has poppy painted on hair
text: kevin turley from shifnal wanted to do something special to mark armistice day this year .
so he had his head shaved and then got a of a poppy painted on , to show his support for the royal british legion and raise some money for the charity .
mr turley , an independent councillor for shifnal , shaved his head last year to raise money for severn hos in memory of his father , and decided he wanted to do something similar again this year .
the hair has now grown over and he also revealed that some of the dye rubbed off in his sleep .
the night after the head shave the loose red dye came off on the pillow .
it looked like i 'd been attacked by an axe-murderer in the night . ''

documents.title: ice hockey : mcewen challenged to make step up
text: telford tigers will look to build on their six-point lead at the top of the english premier league this weekend , with matches at home to bracknell bees tomorrow and away to peterborough phantoms on sunday .
tigers head coach tom watkins is challenging young forward corey mcewen to keep up his scoring form .
mcewen scored four goals last weekend , including a last-minute overtime winner over milton keynes lightning .
it was a remarkable weekend for corey , and he 's a great kid who has come in here , worked hard and is in great shape .
he has got the skills to put up good numbers and is very hard to play against , but of course consistency is a big factor for the young guys . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: funding for new rural health service
text: the gp cooperative that runs an out-of-hours health advice line in shropshire , has been given £ 75,000 for a new project .
shropdoc will spend the money on a new daytime service , providing help for patients in rural areas .
it 's working with the powys teaching health board to support gps ' surgeries .
this is our venture into daytime work to try to support people who live in rural areas . ''

documents.title: tennis : shrewsbury finalists decided
text: petra krejsova of the czech republic will play switzerland 's tess sugnaux in the final of the aegon pro circuit tournament at the shrewsbury club tomorrow .
krejsova beat hong kong 's ling zhang earlier , while sugnaux defeated the 1999 wimbledon semi-finalist alexandra stevenson from the usa .
shrewsbury 's lauren mcminn features in doubles final at 16.30 this afternoon , her first itf final .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: telford businessman wins £ 720 on bet that clinton would become president
text: a telford businessman who bet on hillary clinton making it to the white house is thanking his lucky stars after winning a £ 720 payout despite her defeat by donald trump .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: headlines : services to mark armistice day ; families raise money for surgery ; goalkeeper returns for shrewsbury
text: our headlines this afternoon :
- two-minute silence observed across shropshire to mark armistice day
- two families raise money to send children for life-changing nerve-surgery
- halstead to return for shrewsbury town
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: raf shawbury airmen join prince harry for armistice commemoration
text: helicopter crews from raf shawbury joined prince harry at the national memorial arboretum in staffordshire for the armistice commemoration .
there was a flypast of squirrel helicopters from shropshire 's defence helicopter flying school .
both prince harry and his brother the duke of cambridge trained at raf shawbury and flew squirrel helicopters as part of their course .

documents.title: football : halstead to start for shrewsbury town
text: mark halstead will start in goal for shrewsbury town tomorrow , with the club 's number one goalkeeper jayson leutwiler away on international duty with canada .
halstead says he sees it as an opportunity to impress and maybe force his way into the first team .
whether he 's here or not , if i do alright when i 'm playing then i do n't see any reason why i should n't be playing . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: first performance of music to commemorate ww1
text: a composer is looking forward to hearing his latest work performed in public for the first time tonight .
paul mountford from chelmarsh , near bridgnorth , was commissioned to write a piece commemorating world war one and it 'll be performed this evening in feckenham near droitwich .
the hour-long suite for the fallen soldier mixes music with extracts from imaginary letters of the type that were sent to and from people fighting on the front line .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : two telford schools hold remembrance events
text: remembrance events have been taking place around the county , including at a number of schools .
pupils from the telford park school and the telford langley school got together to hold a joint service .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: second shropshire child to hoping for nerve surgery
text: a family from whitchurch is also raising money to have surgery to help him cope with his cerebral palsy .

charlene harris is hoping to have what is known as a selective dorsal rhizotomy for her son zak ( below ) and needs to raise around £ 40,000 - half of which will be spent on the physiotherapy afterwards .
zak 's surgery will be performed in bristol , at one of five centres to provide the operation in the uk .
consultant neurosurgeon at leeds children 's hospital dr john gooden explained that the operation worked by cutting two-thirds of the nerves next to the spine which controlled sensation in the legs .
and while a slip could end up causing paralysis , he said it was a safe procedure these days and had seen a resurgence in this country in the last five years .

documents.title: church opens for armistice day prayer
text: a privately owned church in shropshire is open all day today for people to pray for those who 've suffered and still suffer because of war .
thought-provoking articles , music , candles , symbols and photos will be on display at st julian 's in shrewsbury .
the church 's owner , andrew wright wants to remember the children from across syria , iraq , eritrea and libya who 've lost their parents , their home and their hope .
author: Kate Tebby
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : tvs recycled at new centre in bridgnorth
text: the new tv recycling centre at bridgnorth is now open and this morning the bbc 's rory cellan jones dropped in to take a look .
the difficulty has always been how to dispose of them safely , with all the dangerous glass and hazardous materials contained within your telly .

documents.title: family halfway to target to send daughter to usa for potentially life-changing surgery
text: a shrewsbury family is halfway towards its £ 60,000 target to send their daughter to the usa for potentially life-changing surgery .
three-year-old isla marshall has a form of celebral palsy which make it difficult to walk , and it 's likely to get worse without treatment .
isla 's mum , lai-chen marshall , says the best place for the selective dorsal rhizotomy operation is in the united states .
author: Genevieve Tudor
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : remembrance events in county ; families raise money for child nerve-surgery ; tennis semi-finals
text: our top stories this lunchtime :
- remembrance events held around the county on armistice day
- two shropshire families raising money for life-changing nerve-surgery
- semi finals day at shrewsbury tennis tournament
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: in memorial events around the county
text: remembrance events have taken place around shropshire this morning .
at the headquarters of shropshire council , a wreath was laid on the memorial stones to commemorate local government staff who lost their lives in the service of their country .
and at shrewsbury college an outdoor service was held in front of a large poppy display created by the students .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: weather : a dry and chilly afternoon ahead
text: it 's going to remain dry and chilly across shropshire this afternoon , with a chance of some rain overnight .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: tennis : semi-finals day at shrewsbury tournament
text: it 's semi-finals day at the aegon pro circuit tournament in shrewsbury today .
top-seed tess sugnaux from switzerland takes on american alexandra stevenson after the match between the czech republic 's petra krejsova and ling zhang from hong kong ( below ) .
and it will be an all-british final in the doubles at 16:30 , with sarah beth grey and olivia nicholls taking on alicia barnett and laura mcminn .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: names of fallen soldiers to be projected on to market hall
text: the names of shropshire servicemen who lost their lives in world war one will be projected on to the side of the shrewsbury market hall tonight .
it 's the work of local artist andy mckeown , who produced the same roll of honour for armistice day last year .

documents.title: football : cowan joins telford coaching staff
text: former telford defender gavin cowan has returned to the club to replace steve wynn as first team coach .
cowan left the bucks in 2010 and has gone on to coach at solihull moors .
telford manager rob smith said he was pleased to have cowan on board and described him as an `` infectious character '' in training .
we 've always kept in touch , and he 's down the road , we 've got a vacancy for a coach and gav had offered to come down and help us out . ''
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: # bigthankyouget inspired
text: do you know someone who does that little bit extra to make sport happen ?
why not give them a chance to get a call from their sporting hero from the bbc sports personality of the year red carpet ?

the # bigthankyou is britain 's biggest celebration of sports volunteers and recognises the thousands of unsung heroes who give up their time to work tirelessly so others can enjoy many sport and fitness activities .
find out more here .

documents.title: dog owner sleeping in van in hope of tracking down missing pet
text: a £ 200 reward is being offered for the safe return of a jack russell who 's been missing for a week from his home in north shropshire .
billy went missing in whixhall .
his owner , ross kayley from oswestry , wants him back so much he 's been sleeping in his van , putting food on the bonnet and sounding a special horn in the hope he 'll return .
mr kayley says billy 's been spotted in whitchurch , wem , tilstock and cockshutt .
i find this quite amazing , because he 's grown up in my truck .
i did n't think he had any traffic experience .
on the busy road coming into wem , they were trying to corral him , with the police and about five other pedestrians .
he bolted past everyone and headed off in the whixhall direction . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: afc telford utd attacts attentions of two overseas investors
text: two overseas investors have shown an interest in putting money into struggling afc telford united , the bbc understands .
the club recently changed its ownership structure .
the most any one person could invest would be £ 100,000 .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: telford remembrance event streamed online
text: a number of remembrance events are taking place at 11:00 to commemorate those who died in combat .
telford and wrekin council is streaming live online from the war memorial at 10:50 .
after 10.50am today we hope to be live on # periscope from telford town park 's war memorial # rethinkremembrance
what time is it on sunday ?

documents.title: latest : family halfway to funding target for op ; dog owner sleeps in van to find missing pet
text: the top stories in shropshire this morning :
- family halfway to £ 60,000 funding target for surgery that 's hoped will transform their daughter 's life
- go-ahead given to housing development in ludlow , despite council 's objections
- dog owner sleeps in van to find missing pet
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: unannounced inspections over 'never event ' errors at telford and shrewsbury hospitals
text: unannounced inspections will take take place at shropshire major hospitals in a bid to tackle a spate of extremely serious '' medical mistakes .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: your west midlands questions answered
text: your west midlands questions answered

documents.title: your west midlands questions answered
text: your west midlands questions answered

documents.title: knife detector at oswestry nightclub in festive crackdown on drugs
text: a metal detector will be set up outside an oswestry nightclub over christmas to search for knives .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: temporary speed restriction on busy a442 in telford
text: telford and wrekin council says it 's introduced a temporary 40 mph speed restriction on the busy a442 , for safety reasons .
it 's because some of the barriers have corroded and need repairing .
there 've been several complaints but the council 's steve hollins says the restrictions are much better than having to close the road .
we do n't do these things willy nilly , we have to take a lot of consideration .
to close the a442 , which is one of the main arterial routes through telford , would be remiss of us .
so that 's why we 've dropped it down to 40mph , to allow traffic to pass through telford as safely as possible . ''
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: planning inspector approves new homes in ludlow
text: a planning inspector has approved plans for a new housing estate in ludlow , overruling shropshire council .
the local authority had rejected the scheme for 137 houses on foldgate lane because of the visual impact on unspoilt countryside .
ludlow councillor andy boddington tweeted that it was `` one of the worst argued approvals '' he 'd seen `` for a goodly while . ''
author: Faith Page
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : latest weather for the west midlands
text: cold and frosty at first , with some patchy fog in places .
this will slowly clear to give a fine but cold day with some crisp sunshine .
top temperatures of 7c ( 45f )
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: planning inspector overrules shropshire council on housing development ; temporary speed restrictions on busy a442
text: the top stories in shropshire this morning :
- planning inspector overrules shropshire council to give go-ahead on new houses in telford

text: no accidents to report on the county 's roads so far this morning .
traffic is slow though on the a49 southbound in shrewsbury at the sundorne roundabout .
for more information visit the bbc travel page .

documents.title: weather : rain clearing and a clear night ahead
text: the rain should disappear by the end of the evening and most of us should have a clear and chilly night .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: headlines : call for further hospital review delay ; a & e waiting times up ; museums win vase auction
text: our headlines this evening :

- a & e waiting times up at shrewsbury and telford hospitals

author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : university investigates the feasibility of drones on farms
text: swarms of airborne drones could one day be used by farmers for pest control on their crops .
it could reduce the use of chemicals and so be better for the environment .
but , first the law has to catch up with the technology and that 's an issue harper adams university is looking at .
author: David Gregory-Kumar
Science correspondent, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: football : shrewsbury captain should be fit for saturday
text: shrewsbury town captain adam el-abd is expected to be fit in time to play against oxford united this saturday .
he missed tuesday night 's win at middlesbrough , but his calf injury is n't as bad as first thought .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: 31 measures to prevent pollution of long mynd spring water
text: thirty-one measures to ensure new houses will not pollute a source of shropshire spring water have been sent to the environment agency .
author: South Shropshire Journal

documents.title: call for further delay to hospitals review
text: there have been calls for a further delay to the review of hospital services in the county .
telford and wrekin council is unhappy about a report which recommended downgrading a & e in telford and moving women and children 's services to shrewsbury .
it has written to the future fit review body responsible to highlight a number of concerns about the decision-making process .
the local authority says those concerns still have n't been addressed and has written another letter to say it wants the process put on hold until they are .
it also wants future fit to agree the process has been `` flawed '' .

documents.title: roadside sign catches fire in ford
text: a `` keep left '' sign has caught fire in ford this afternoon .
the fire service were alerted by a passer-by and say it appears to have started with the cables underneath the sign .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: tennis : quarter finals under way at shrewsbury
text: the quarter finals are under way at the aegon pro circuit tournament in shrewsbury and it 's the players from overseas having the better day .
laura sainsbury and sarah beth grey have both been knocked out , leaving maia lumsden the sole remaining brit in the competition - she faces top seed tess sugnaux .
american alexandra stevenson and ling zhang from hong kong are both safely through to the semi-finals along with petra krejsova of croatia .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: celebs shunned for shrewsbury christmas lights switch-on
text: the winner of a lantern-making competition for children will be asked to switch on the shrewsbury christmas lights this year .
the annual switch-on will take place on wednesday 16 november , and a number of bands and choirs have been booked to entertain the crowds .

a traditional lantern parade ( similar to the one photographed above last year ) will pass through the town and at the end the town mayor will choose the maker of the best lantern to hit the button with him .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: museums win auction for coalport vase
text: the ironbridge gorge museums have won an auction to buy a large vase , made in coalport in the 19th century .
the northumberland vase is thought to be one of the largest pieces of coalport china ever made and had been on loan to the museums , before it 's owner decided to put it up for sale .
the museums launched an appeal to raise enough money to buy it and had a bid of £ 14,000 accepted at auction earlier today .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: lower speed limits on queensway because of corroded barriers
text: a new speed limit has been introduced on a section of the a442 queensway in telford after corroded safety barriers were discovered by engineers .
telford and wrekin council says some barriers have a `` substantial amount of corrosion '' and are having to be replaced , with the bulk of the work being carried out in the evenings .
the authority says that until it has finished the work , the speed limit queensway between hollinswood interchange and stirchley interchange will remain at 40mph instead of the usual 60mph .
and it says if the problem had been allowed to get worse , the road might have had to be shut completely , for safety reasons .

documents.title: bed blocking remains a problem for shropshire hospitals
text: delays in discharging patients from hospital in england rose to a record level in september .
it was the third month running that the total hit a new high .
the figure for shropshire 's two acute hospitals was down on august , but up 16 % on the same month last year .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: armed gang force their way into highley home
text: detectives are looking for a gang who have forced their way into a house on the high street in highley , armed with knives and iron bars .
they took a bag containing cash and personal items .
the victim was n't injured .
the three men , who had their faces concealed , were wearing black clothing and escaped in a dark coloured car , police say .
author: Faith Page
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

text: our top stories this evening include :
- a & e waiting times go up at shropshire hospitals

BBC Shropshire

documents.title: your photos : more photos of the autumn around shropshire
text: here are some more photos shared by the bbc weather watchers this afternoon .
the spiders web was taken near shrewsbury and the rainbow below it was taken near hopton heath .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: fugitive sex offender found hiding under bed in market drayton
text: a sex offender who has been on the run since september has been found hiding under a bed by police in market drayton .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: tree of light to be switched on in telford
text: the telford tree of light is being switched on in the town centre this afternoon .

last year it helped telford rotary club raise over £ 42,000 for a number of local charities and this year half the money will go to severn hos with the rest going to hope house , the kip project , homestart and age uk .
the bulk of the money is raised by asking people to pay £ 5 to have the name of a loved one engraved at the base of the tree and £ 21,000 has been collected so far .
the switch-on is at 16:00 .

documents.title: a & e waiting times go up
text: accident and emergency units in shrewsbury and telford recorded their worst performances for several months in september , with just 81.5 % of patients dealt with inside the government 's four-hour target .
just over 11,500 patients were treated in local a & es last month , the lowest number since at least april , the earliest figures available under the current format from nhs england .
despite that , september 's performance was the poorest in at least five months - 95 % of patients are meant to be treated within four hours , according to national guidelines .
in august , 11,843 a & e patients were treated in shrewsbury and telford - 82.2 % inside four hours .

documents.title: 50 jobs in new shrewsbury motor dealership plan
text: more than 50 jobs could be created if a motor dealer gets the go ahead to build a new showroom and service centre .
author: Shrewsbury Chronicle

documents.title: ukip 's evans decides not to stand in by-election
text: ukip 's suzanne evans wo n't be cutting her ties with shropshire , after deciding she does n't want to go to lincolnshire to be the party 's candidate in a parliamentary by-election .

she stood as ukips candidate in shrewsbury last year and still has a house in the town , but was advised that if she stood in this by-election she would have to pull out of the race to be the party 's next leader .

ms evans was told by the party chairman that if she stood for the sleaford and north hykeham seat , she would get the benefit of being promoted by the party - and that would put her at an unfair advantage in the leadership election .
i quite understand the dilemma this would put ukip in and have concluded my priority must be to continue to set out my stall for the leadership . ''

documents.title: headlines : concern over business rate rise ; pine marten appeal ; telford part ways with hurst
text: our top stories this lunchtime :
- concerns about business rate increase in ludlow
- wildlife trust raising money to look after pine martens
- telford part ways with james hurst after twitter comments
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : telford part ways with james hurst
text: afc telford united have fined james hurst two weeks ' wages and have told him he can leave .
the former west bromwich albion utility player was in trouble because of comments made on social media after he was sent-off in the game against salford city .
hurst has now been transfer-listed and wo n't play for the club again .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: horse racing at ludlow this afternoon
text: we 've got six races at ludlow this afternoon , with the first getting under way at 13:35 .
the condition of the course is being reported as good .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: 'sus holly wreath-carrying men hunted by police
text: two men carrying holly wreathes are being hunted by police investigating a house burglary in telford .
residents in shawbirch posted warning messages on facebook after the pair were spotted acting in a `` sus manner on monday morning , around the same time a home on monet close was broken in to .
two men have since been arrested and charged with burglary .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: hibernating hedgehogs helped
text: with winter approaching , the shropshire wildlife trust is giving hedgehogs a bit of help as they prepare to go into hibernation .
it 's been feeding them up and putting them in cardboard boxes and they will then be released back into the wild in the spring .

the trust explained that hedgehog numbers are on the decline and says that if you want to help them fatten up , the best thing to do is leave them cat or dog food - but do n't give them bread and milk .

documents.title: police hunt cyclist after telford collision
text: police are trying to trace a cyclist who collided with a woman in her 60s in telford at the weekend , knocking her unconscious .
the woman was taken to hospital in stoke , where she remains in a stable condition .
the collision is believed to have happened on dark lane , in the hinkshay road area at around 19:00 on saturday .

documents.title: fairytale shropshire home awakens as family returns to mansion
text: a fairytale house in the depths of the shropshire countryside is awakening from a 25-year slumber thanks to its new owners .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: traffic wardens in telford up for discussion
text: the introduction of traffic wardens in and around telford will be discussed later .
telford and wrekin council 's minority conservative group is trying to persuade the labour-run authority to bring them in .
under government rules the council could take over parking enforcement powers from the police .
the issue will be considered at a scrutiny committee this evening .

documents.title: trust appeals for donations to help protect pine martens
text: following on from last year 's sighting of a wild pine marten in shropshire , a fresh appeal has been launched to help protect their habitat .
there 's a small population of the elusive animal near pontesbury .
shropshire wildlife trust has just launched a crowdfunding project to raise £ 12,000 .
the money will be used to monitor and conserve the woodlands , provide cover and food and set up volunteering opportunities .

documents.title: couple remain in critical condition after crash
text: an elderly couple , injured in a car crash in telford a week ago , remain in hospital , in a critical condition .
an 89-year-old man and an 83-year-old woman , suffered head injuries in the collision , on springhill road in dawley .
police have renewed an appeal for witnesses to the crash , near the junction with station road and particularly want to hear from the driver of a white lorry which was in the area .
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: ludlow retailers worry over rates rise
text: independent retailers in ludlow are worried about the consequences of a large increase in business rates .
the town 's chamber of commerce will discuss the issue next week .
the amount is based on a property 's rateable value and many businesses have had letters saying they 'll have to pay more from april 2017 .
some independent retailers say they ca n't absorb the increase , which one shop owner said amounts to a rise of more than 80 % .

documents.title: troops put on standby to deal with flooding
text: more than 1,000 uk troops have been put on 24-hour stand-by to help in the event of flooding this winter .
the government says it is also investing £ 12.5m in new temporary flood defences for its `` most comprehensive winter plan yet '' .
the latest news from the government follows a review of the handling of the problems caused by storm desmond in parts of the uk late last year .
last winter there were flood warnings issued across shropshire and temporary barriers were erected in shrewsbury and ironbridge .

documents.title: health bosses chasing shropshire council for debts
text: finance bosses from shropshire 's clinical commissioning group will meet shropshire council tonight to discuss unpaid invoices .
the ccg also says it is owed money by welsh hospitals for the treatment of patients from over the border .
the ccg says there are debts it owes to shropshire council , as well as others owed by the local authority to the nhs .

documents.title: auctioneer delighted with chinese brush pot sale
text: the auctioneer who sold a chinese lacquer pot for £ 155,000 this afternoon says he 's delighted with the price it went for .
it sold for nearly four times the guide price and alexander clement , halls ' asian art specialist , said he looked forward to calling the owner , to deliver the good news .
mr clement also said there had been interest in the brush pot from around the world , particularly in china , but also from north america .
this is a new record for our battlefield sale room and it is one of the best things i 've sold .
it will take some beating . ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: man cut out of vehicle after crash in ludlow
text: firefighters are cutting a man out of his car in ludlow after it came off the road and hit some wooden posts .
it happened just before 16:00 near the junction of weeping cross lane and temeseide .
the ambulance service says the man is in his 30s and has been complaining of back pain .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: spate of land rover defender thefts around edgmond
text: there 's been a spate of land rover thefts in the edgmond area , the last one happening last night .
police say four defender models , which have gone out of production , have been taken since mid-september .
two have since been recovered and owners have been advised to fit tracking devices .
police say they will be carrying out extra patrols around the edgmond area .
not only are these vehicles very expensive to purchase in the first place , they retain that value very well , both as complete vehicles and when broken for parts . ''

documents.title: your photos : the sun comes out around shropshire
text: the sun seems to have come out around shropshire this afternoon and we 're seeing some nice from around the county - thanks to the bbc weather watchers .
these were taken in oswestry ( top ) and near dorrington ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: hospital review hits another delay
text: the reorganising of hospital services in the county appears to have been hit by another delay .
the chair of shropshire 's clinical commissioning group dr julian povey told a meeting this afternoon the future fit review is being held up by another nhs review .
wendy saviour , from nhs england , said that work probably wo n't be completed until christmas .
the result might be that public consultation ca n't start in the first week of january .
the project has already taken almost three years and cost millions of pounds .

documents.title: raf shawbury welcomes mod announcement
text: the news that another 125 mod personnel could be moving to raf shawbury has been welcomed by the man in charge there .

group captain jason appleton , the station commander at raf shawbury said it was `` further confirmation that the mod considers raf shawbury to be one of the core stations in the raf for years to come . ''
there are already 600 military personnel , 43 civil servants and 469 contractors based at raf shawbury .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

text: a couple have won a long legal battle that will see them build their dream home on the shropshire border .

documents.title: chinese brush pot sells for £ 155,000
text: a chinese brush pot has stunned auctioneers in shrewsbury by selling for £ 155,000 this afternoon .
it belonged to a shropshire woman who brought it in to be valued by experts at halls earlier in the year and she was told it was probably worth £ 40,000 .
the auctioneer who sold it , alexander clement , was n't able to reveal who the buyer was , other than to say it had been bought by a telephone-bidder .
in my wildest imaginings i 'd hoped to get above £ 100,000 .
getting over £ 150,000 is fantastic and really exciting for us . ''

documents.title: driving instructors charity drive through shropshire
text: the big learner relay is making its way through shropshire today .
driving instructors and pupils from around the country are spending two weeks raising money for children in need by completing 3,000 miles worth of driving lessons , in a relay .
the driving instructors will be doing this by passing a special learner drive sign ( above ) from one driving lesson to the next and have been in shrewsbury this afternoon .

documents.title: final day of voting for park awards
text: today is the final day of voting for the uk 's best park awards , with two shropshire parks hoping to win the west midlands crown .
the online poll is being run by fields in trust and both telford town park ( below ) and church stretton town park have been nominated .

documents.title: tennis : second round underway in shrewsbury
text: the second round of the aegon pro circuit event is under way in shrewsbury and the first winner is a brit .
sarah grey was a game and set up against the third seed helene scholsen of belgium when her opponent was forced to retire .
later , the number one seed from switzerland tess sugnaux is due on court for her second-round match .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: whitchurch herald front page : pub 's gift of life
text: a group of whitchurch pub regulars have helped their landlord raise money to buy a defibrillator after two customers were taken ill on the premises .
front page : your latest whitchurch herald is out now , priced 75p .
do n't miss your copy # shropll
author: Whitchurch Herald

documents.title: donnington army units moving to stafford
text: the same mod review which gave details of the raf staff moving to shawbury also contains details of the plans for the two donnington barracks which are closing in the next four years .

it was announced earlier in the year that the parsons barracks would be shut down , but we now know the royal military police units based there will most likely move to the beacon barracks in stafford .
stafford is also the likely destination for the headquarters of the 11 signal brigade , while the headquarters of the 7 signal group will probably move to salisbury .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: over 100 mod personnel could move to raf shawbury
text: the ministry of defence has been giving more details of the personnel who could be moving to raf shawbury , from a base near bristol .
it is closing a base known as 1300 parkway , as part of a wider sale of mod property , which is home to 46 military personnel and 79 civilian staff .

the bristol site is currently home to the military flying training system and the team headquarters of defence flying training - both units are due to transfer to the shawbury base , although it 's not yet been decided whether all 125 staff will move .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: chinese brush pot could fetch £ 40k at auction
text: a chinese brush pot is expected to sell for about £ 40,000 at auction in shrewsbury today .
its owner from south shropshire had no idea it was worth anything when she took it to be valued at halls auctioneers and after getting a pleasant surprise she decided to sell it .
further research revealed that it 's an 18th century chinese cinnabar lacquer brush pot de an esteemed chinese calligrapher on a veranda watching his geese .
halls say they 're expecting interest from china and possibly the usa when it 's auctioned today .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

text: the wet weather is going to remain with us this afternoon and it 's going to stay chilly too .

BBC weather presenter

text: there 's been an accident on whitchurch road in shrewsbury involving a bicycle and a car and it 's blocking the road in both directions near the heathgates roundabout .

text: young people threw burning toilet rolls around a town 's high street during late night partying , it has been claimed .

documents.title: trump 'could be good for region 's exporters '
text: business leaders in the west midlands are at a post usa election breakfast this morning and there 's been a mixed reaction to the overnight result .
paul forrest from west midlands economic forum said a trump presidency could be good for exporters in the region .
during the eu referendum , president obama warned that britain would `` go to the back of the queue '' if people voted for brexit .
however , speaking at the beginning of this month , donald trump 's trade adviser said britain would be first for a trade deal under a trump presidency .
author: Kathryn Stanczyszyn
Political Reporter, BBC WM

documents.title: pcc u-turn over budget
text: only last monday , mr campion told the bbc the budget was `` enough '' to do the job .
we still get over £ 200m a year and i think i 'm given enough resources to deliver a good level of service , as long as i 'm getting better value for money . ''

documents.title: police and crime commissioner calls for fairer funding deal
text: the police and crime commissioner for west mercia , john campion , is asking the policing minister for more money .
he 's contacted brandon lewis highlighting the challenges faced by rural areas - to try to secure a greater share of government 's financial support .
this year 's total budget for policing in the west mercia area , that 's shropshire , hereford & worcester , is just over £ 207m , almost £ 110m of which comes from the government .
there are a range of clear and unique challenges to policing in our area .
i do n't feel the current funding formula acknowledges these properly and certainly does n't offer our communities the sort of value for money they should rightfully expect . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shrewsbury street pastors celebrate fifth anniversary
text: the shrewsbury street pastor group is five years old today .
it was set up to tackle the number of river deaths and every saturday night christian volunteers patrol the town looking after vulnerable people .
the group now has its own vehicle and headquarters , and future plans may include pastors for the university centre - and expanding to other towns like oswestry and ludlow .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shrewsbury town win final game in the checkatrade trophy
text: shrewsbury town ended their run in the checkatrade trophy on a high last night when they won their final group game .
they beat middlesborough 's development side 3-0 , with two goals from aj leitch-smith and an ivan toney 's free kick settled it .
both sides knew before the start that they could n't make it to the knock out stages .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: plan for seven-metre-high bridge over the river corve in ludlow is shelved
text: a developer who 'd planned to build a seven-metre-high bridge over the river corve in ludlow as part of a new housing development has asked to remove it from the scheme .
tensi are building more than 200 houses off the a49 and people living in a nearby cul-de-sac have objected to the footbridge , which they say could turn their quiet street into a car park .
the developer has now applied to change its plans for the bromfield road development , removing the bridge designed for pedestrians and cyclists .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shropshire councillor under investigation
text: a shropshire councillor 's being investigated over claims of planning irregularities and will go before a standards committee next monday .

two complaints have been made against conservative councillor joyce barrow - one centres around the british ironworks centre and the fact that the oswestry tourist attraction has grown in recent years , sometimes without the relevant planning permission .
the second alleges ms barrow breached the council 's code of conduct by failing to declare an interest in relation to land owned by her husband .
shropshire council 's refused to confirm or deny the allegation .
councillor barrow has n't commented .
author: Joanne Gallacher
Political reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: review promised following surgical errors
text: earlier this afternoon , chris morris , lead nurse on telford and wrekin 's clinical commissioning group ( ccg ) warned fellow board members about the number of surgical mistakes being reported , saying it was `` likely that some of these events will lead to litigation '' .
she added that there 's no common theme to why the events occurred , but work would now be carried out on pre- and post- operative checks and a full and through review will be set up .
ms morris was asked how shrewsbury and telford hospital trust compared to other trusts , but she could n't answer .
it was suggested that a five-year report should be put together to see how things have been over a longer period .
author: Joanne Gallacher
Political reporter, BBC Shropshire

text: fraudster susan weston conned a vulnerable pensioner out of £ 80,000 - but has been ordered to pay back just £ 10 .
author: Market Drayton Advertiser

documents.title: football : efl cup tie a chance for whalley to impress
text: shrewsbury town 's match against middlesborough tonight might be a dead-rubber as far as the efl trophy goes , but it 's an important chance for players to prove a point to the new manager .
neither side can reach the knock-out stages , but paul hurst is promising to field a strong side and that could include a return for shaun whalley .
the utility player has been suffering from knee problems .
it 's a chance to show the new manager what i can do and it 's an important game to prove my fitness as well . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: raf shawbury move part of mod shake-up
text: the announcement that more people are going to be stationed at raf shawbury has come as part of a wider mod review of its properties .
the report , entitled a better defence estate , details plans to sell off some older bases and cut costs , while investing another £ 4bn in its remaining property .
it explains the units moving to shawbury from bristol include the head office of defence flying training .

documents.title: slow cooker causes bridgnorth fire
text: firefighters have been called to a house in bridgnorth this afternoon after a slow cooker set a towel alight .
they took just 15 minutes dealing with the fire and there was no serious damage done .

documents.title: raf shawbury to get extra personnel
text: the mod has announced it will be basing more units at raf shawbury from 2020 .
in a letter to the north shropshire mp , owen paterson , it said they will be moving there from the parkway base near bristol .
the letter also confirmes the mod intends to push ahead with the sale of the clive barracks near market drayton , which it hopes to complete in 2022 .

documents.title: call for oswestry street to be reopened to traffic
text: there 's been a call to remove the bollards from cross street in oswestry and open it up to traffic again .
shropshire councillor , steve charmley , says empty shops there are giving it a `` ghost town '' feel and wants the pedestrian zone removed for a trial period of six months .
mr charmley says the road could still be closed for special events , but believes the move would show the street is `` open for business '' .
it is clear that the cross street area of the town is really struggling - the empty shops do not give a positive entrance to the town .
we need to change the dynamic of this part of the town - at present it 's just not going to attract new business to the town . ''

documents.title: gritter fleets poised and watching the weather forecast
text: with temperatures due to drop again tonight and the chance of snow in places , shropshire 's local authorities are watching the forecast carefully .
last night gritters went out on the county 's roads and shropshire council says it will sent out its snow ploughs if the snow is deeper than 5cm ( 2in ) .
shropshire council adds that it prioritises which roads to clear , and aims to ensure towns and large villages have at least one main access route as soon as possible .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: telford man charged after getting car stuck on metro track
text: a telford driver has been arrested and charged on sus of drink driving after a car was became stuck on the tracks at snow hill metro station in the west midlands .

documents.title: tennis : number one seed safely through at shrewsbury event
text: play is well underway now at the pro-circuit women 's tennis tournament in shrewsbury and the number one seed , tess sugnaux , is safely through to the second round .
the 21-year-old swiss player had a straight-sets win over the british qualifier louise holtum .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: concern that surgical mistakes could lead to legal action
text: there are concerns so-called `` never events '' could lead to legal action against shrewsbury and telford nhs trust .
in the past year there have been six cases of operational apparatus being left inside a patient and three of them have occurred in the last month .
nhs england has said this is a `` surprising trend '' and the hospital trust 's medical director has said he 's `` concerned '' .
chris morris , lead nurse on telford and wrekin 's clinical commissioning group said `` it 's likely that some of these events will lead to litigation '' .
author: Joanne Gallacher
Political reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : tns chasing european wins record
text: the new saints recorded their 16th straight win in welsh domestic competitions at the weekend , but they have some way to go to break the european record for consecutive victories .
according to uefa , that honour is held by the portuguese side benfica , who recorded 29 straight victories in domestic competition between 1971 and 1973 .
that was a side which included eusebio ( below ) .
just below benfica , with 28 straight domestic wins , are the dinamo zagreb side from 2006-07 , which included players like eduardo , luka modric and vedran corluka .
the english record for consecutive league wins ( not including cups ) is 14 and that is jointly held by arsenal , manchester united , preston north end and bristol city .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

text: village now a 'not spot ' for superfast broadband - despite bt base right on its doorstep .

documents.title: bridgnorth gambles to impress award judges
text: the people running bridgnorth 's bid to win a national high street award say they want to give the judges a `` warts and all '' tour , complete with empty shops and buildings needing attention .

one of them , sally themans , said `` we are a real town and every town will have those challenges '' , but admitted she had also been up early to wash the town 's information boards and planned to go out and sweep up some leaves later .
bridgnorth is competing with hinckley and market harborough , both in leicestershire .
the winner will be decided partly on the marks given by the judges and partly by an online vote , with polling closing on 18 november - bridgnorth is currently leading that online vote .

documents.title: about a quarter of shropshire children living in poverty , study says
text: new figures shows that 20 % of children in shropshire , and 28 % in telford and wrekin are living in poverty .
the end child poverty coalition is calling on the government to end the freeze on children 's benefits and reverse the sharp cuts being introduced to in-work benefits under universal credit .
the coalition says more than 3.5m children are living in poverty in the uk today .

documents.title: child burial charge scrapped by council
text: the charge for child burials is to be scrapped by telford and wrekin council .
the cost of the burial itself and for a plot of land are already free , but the council is now also waiving a fee of around £ 200 , meaning there will be nothing to pay from now on .
losing a child is an unimaginable horror for any parent .
this grief can be greatly amplified by the stress of not being able to pay for a burial or proper funeral .
local authorities sometimes have it within their gift to show some compassion and that is absolutely correct in this instance to offer further help to bereaved families at a very difficult time . ''

documents.title: award for community cinema
text: the kinokulture cinema in oswestry has won a national award as the uk 's top independent community house .
it is run by ruth carter and ian garland in a converted chapel and shows a mix of current blockbusters and more art-house films .
the film society of the year awards were organised by the cinema for all film group .

documents.title: judges to be shown the `` real '' bridgnorth
text: with 10 days to go , bridgnorth is leading the public vote to be crowned britain 's best large market town high street , but the people behind the bid do n't want to see any complacency .
the judges from the great british high street of the year awards are visiting the town today and will be shown the severn valley railway station , the cliff railway and the high street itself .

one of the people leading bridgnorth 's campaign , sally themans ( above ) , said they were also gambling on showing the judges the `` real '' town , so they would also be visiting an industrial estate and showing it as a `` working place '' .
the winner of the award gets £ 5,000 and will be announced in december .

documents.title: tennis : women 's tournament gets underway in shrewsbury
text: the aegon gb pro-series tennis tournament is underway in shrewsbury today .
the women 's competition is being played at the shrewsbury club , with the top seed 21-year-old tess sugnaux from switzerland .
she will be playing british qualifier louise holtum ( below ) .

documents.title: weather : heavy rain with the chance of snow later
text: we 've had a dry few weeks , but that all changes today , with heavy rain forecast throughout the day .
and later we might also get a bit of snow as temperatures fall .
author: Kay Crewdson
BBC weather presenter

documents.title: your frosty shropshire
text: there 's been a very chilly start to the day .
keep your frosty coming , you can get in touch via email , twitter or facebook .

documents.title: ban for shropshire haulier
text: a shropshire haulier , jailed earlier this year , has been banned from operating trucks indefinitely by the traffic commissioner .

the industry regulator said stephen holding 's lack of regard for safety `` beggars belief '' and also revoked the licenses of his companies , s p holding tractor hire ltd and s p holding services ltd .
in january , mr holding , from sp holding in telford , was sentenced to eight months in prison for falsifying driver records .
he allowed and encouraged 10 of his drivers to commit 79 offences , mostly covering up the fact they drove for longer than the law allows .
on one occasion , a driver worked for 72 hours without a sufficient break .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: warning of snow later today
text: we 're forecast a bit of snow later today and into tomorrow morning .
it 'll only be a few centimetres at the most , but the met office has issued severe weather warning .

documents.title: efl trophy : middlesbrough v shrewsbury
text: shrewsbury town play away at middlesbrough tonight in their final efl trophy group game .
neither club can make the knock-out stages , but manager paul hurst is promising to field a strong side .
the competition 's new format has had much criticism , but hurst feels it 's unfair .
if people come up with some better ideas then fair enough , but i have n't got any better ideas so i 'm not going to get on at people that are , at least , trying to create a bit of interest . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shropshire high street bids to be the best in britain
text: judges are due in bridgnorth this morning to see if it 's a potential winner for the title best large market town high street in britain .
the decision will be made by judges , together with a public vote .
so far 150,000 votes have been cast .

text: temperatures dropped to freezing overnight so shropshire has woken to a frost-covered county .

text: shrewsbury town must wait until next week before finding out their opponents in the second round of the fa cup .
it 'll be either fleetwood or non-league southport , who drew 0-0 in their first round match last night .
the replay is next tuesday .

text: idsall school in shifnal is closed for the day after contractors cut through the gas mains .
it means there is no heating or catering facilities .
the headteacher has posted a message on the school 's website , saying it 'll be open as usual tomorrow .
the nursery attached to the school is also closed .

Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: in dog charity parades animals around shrewsbury
text: a dog rehoming charity has been parading some of its animals around the quarry in shrewsbury , to get them a bit of attention and maybe a new owner .
finding furever homes uses the moorlands kennels near condover to house around 30 dogs who need new homes and took 15 out on a walk over the weekend .
here are a few of them .

documents.title: shropshire gritting lorries out tonight
text: the gritting lorries are going out around shropshire tonight .
they were out for the first time this winter on saturday and with overnight temperatures set to drop to freezing regularly over the coming weeks , we could be seeing more of them .

documents.title: watch : temperatures dropping below freezing overnight
text: temperatures will drop below freezing for some of us tonight and tomorrow we 're going to see some rain .
lows of 1c ( 34f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: paramedics : rise in attacks on staff fuelled by substances formerly called 'legal highs '
text: there 's been an `` explosion '' in parts of the midlands in the number of people who 've taken substances which used to be called legal highs .
police forces are saying there 's increasing use , and that , according to west midlands ambulance service , is leading to more attacks on paramedics trying to help those under the influence .
but many of the traditional methods to treat users do n't work because crews do n't always know what 's in the substances .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: mp says there should be a 'bridgnorth ' constituency
text: the wrekin constituency should be renamed `` bridgnorth '' , the mp for ludlow says .

the boundary commission for england is consulting on making a number of changes to constituency boundaries , including adding bridgnorth and its surrounding area to the wrekin seat , to create what it has titled a `` bridgnorth , wellington and the wrekin '' constituency .
philip dunne says that 's too much of a mouthful and thinks it would be easier just to call it the bridgnorth constituency .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

BBC Shropshire

yellow alert of snow for west midlands

documents.title: shrewsbury pub robbed by armed men
text: two men have robbed a pub in shrewsbury , attacking a man living there with what police say could have been a crowbar .
the police say the robbery happened at 05:30 on saturday at the featherbed pub on battlefield road and the men were able to force him to open up the safe and took the cash inside .
the pair then escaped in a small , light-coloured car .
the victim received treatment for his injuries , which are n't serious , police say .
this was understandably a frightening incident for the victim and we are currently investigating a number of lines of enquiry . ''

documents.title: new gp practice waiting for phones to be installed
text: the new claypit street medical practice in whitchurch is still waiting to have its phones installed , a week after it opened .

the doctor 's cooperative shropdoc agreed to set it up at short notice , following the closure of the old richmond house practice and says it has been `` a major task getting everything into place in a relatively short space of time '' .
shropdoc says it is confident the phone system will be up and running soon and has a limited contingency service in place to take calls .
shropdoc has been advised the problem has been escalated and the process will be accelerated to meet the urgent requirements for access to our patients . ''

documents.title: midwife-led maternity unit reopens
text: midwife-led maternity unit reopens

documents.title: shrewsbury mp wants uk to work more closely with eastern europe
text: the polish-born mp for shrewsbury and atcham , daniel kawczynski , has co-written an article saying the uk should strengthen its ties with eastern europe .
he says hungary , czechia ( the former czech republic ) , poland and slovakia have become an important check to the influence of france and germany within the european union .
he says with britain due to remain within the eu for at least the next two years , it is important to support nations which challenge `` brussels 's autocracy '' .

documents.title: breakingshrewsbury town looking for new stadium sponsor
text: shrewsbury town are searching for a new stadium and shirt sponsor , after greenhous announced they wo n't continuing their support beyond the end of this season .
the company has been sponsors of the club in some form or another for 40 years , but says it has been reviewing its sponsorship agreements and will look to support it in other ways in the future .
shrewsbury 's stadium has been known as the greenhous meadow since 2010 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: ludlow mp wants to keep much wenlock in his constituency
text: the ludlow mp , philip dunne , is calling for much wenlock to remain in his constituency .
proposals being discussed at a public hearing in shrewsbury today would see the seat moving south to include parts of north herefordshire .
that would mean the bridgnorth area joining with the current wrekin seat , but mr dunne told the hearing much wenlock had more in common with corvedale and the south .
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: cola truck to visit telford
text: the coca cola lorry will be visiting telford on 14 december , as part of its tour around the country .
yes , it 's an advert for a brand of cola , but it 's also become part of christmas and telford shopping centre will be one of the final stops on its journey this year .

text: a family is appealing for help to get a specialist car seat for their son - the seat will help him travel without pain .
author: Newport Advertiser

documents.title: police hunt former inmate
text: the police are trying to find a telford man who has to return to hmp hewell in redditch , because he broke the terms of his release .
andrew mcnab was allowed to leave on 28 october after serving a sentence for committing grievous bodily harm with intent .
the police say the 31-year-old has since breached his licence conditions and he has connections to the telford and newport areas .

documents.title: football : shrewsbury in the hat for fa cup draw
text: shrewsbury town will be ball number 30 in tonight 's fa cup second round draw .
it 's due to take place at 19:10 , just before the televised match between southport and fleetwood town .
there will be no big clubs until the third round stage , but there 's still the chance of drawing a minnow like taunton town , dover athletic or boreham wood .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: ludlow hospital now offering water births
text: women in ludlow will have the option of having a water birth from today .
it 's been made possible because of the closure of the old midwife-led unit and the move to the main building of the ludlow community hospital .
the birthing-pool and the rest of the birthing unit opened this morning and they are likely to remain within stretton ward for the next 12 months .
the shrewsbury and telford hospital trust says it has n't decided if maternity services will remain within the hospital in the longer-term .
the stretton ward provides a very good environment for women .
we have two labour rooms and a warm and comfortable space for day services . ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: your photos : frosty from around shropshire
text: there was a lot of frost around this morning and you might have had to scrape your car windows first thing .
these photos were taken in telford and norton by bbc weather watchers and show the ice clinging to leaves .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: sir cliff to perform in shropshire
text: sir cliff richard has announced he 'll be performing in south shropshire next year as part of a short tour of the uk and ireland .
he 's due to appear at walcot hall at lydbury north , near bishops castle , on wednesday , 21 june .

documents.title: shrewsbury maternity unit reopens after delay
text: shrewsbury 's maternity unit has reopened after work to fix the heating , a week later than expected .
engineers were called in on 17 october and mums-to-be were transferred elsewhere and told it would take a fortnight to reopen - in the end it took three weeks .
the hospital 's head of women and children 's care , jo banks , said the unit was built in the 1960s and was `` getting tired '' , meaning there is a never-ending programme of work to keep it open .
ludlow was also briefly without its maternity unit last month and it has now been moved to a room within the community hospital , after the original building was found to be unsafe .

documents.title: watch : shropshire girl sets up children in need ramble
text: well done to 10-year-old rosa wood , who organised one of the shropshire rambles for bbc children in need featured on countryfile last night .
if you missed it , the whole show 's here .

documents.title: ambulance service seeing more attacks on paramedics
text: it 's claimed an increase in people taking so-called `` legal highs '' across the west midlands is leading to more attacks on paramedics .
west midlands ambulance service says medics trying to treat users are often subject abuse .
they also claim that traditional methods to treat people do n't work , because they often do n't know what 's in the drugs that have been taken .

documents.title: a quiet bonfire and fireworks weekend for shropshire firefighters
text: shropshire 's fire service says it had a relatively quiet bonfire weekend and only had to deal with a handful of fires which had been left burning and a stray firework which set fire to a tree in telford .
it 's spokesperson , guy williams , said there had been concerns after anti-social behaviour last year , but he described this year 's 5 november as a `` fantastic night '' .

text: the new saints continued their winning streak at the weekend .
they beat bangor 2-1 to make it 14 welsh premier league wins in a row .
i do n't think we were at our best but i think that was due to bangor , they played well . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: your views wanted on proposed boundary changes
text: there is a chance today to have your say on the way shropshire 's constituencies are laid out .

the boundary commission for england have proposed changes to reduce the number of mps in parliament from 650 to 600 and to make constituencies a more equal size - this means a number of changes for shropshire .
the commission will be at shrewsbury 's prince rupert hotel this morning to gather opinions .

documents.title: ice hockey : tigers strike lightning twice
text: telford tigers are still unbeaten at home this season .
they overcame their nearest rivals , milton keynes lightning , twice over the weekend .
6-3 last night and 2-1 on saturday .
tigers are now six points clear at the top of the english premier league .
i thought we got better as the game wore on , defended better and were smarter on the puck . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: three serious surgery mistakes at hospital
text: health bosses , meeting this week , will discuss three serious mistakes in less than a fortnight during surgery at the royal shrewsbury hospital .
on the 11 october , after sinus surgery , a patient was accidentally left with a piece of gauze up their nose .
the day before , a guide-wire had been left inside a patient and then 11 days later the same thing happened again .
guide wires are used to make sure a tube or some other medical item is guided to the right part of the body during surgery .
there have been six so-called `` never events '' since september last year .
author: Faith Page
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: enterprise fund is four-times over-subscribed
text: a government funding pot used to help the local economy grow is four-times over-subscribed and will mean a reduction in the amount of cash handed out across the county .
the marches local enterprise partnership has been told its bid of £ 68m is too high , and needs to be cut by up to 80 % .
this reduction means a number of projects which would have brought new jobs to the county will now be shelved .
